fact: Wichita produces more aircraft than any other city on Earth, earning it the title 'Air Capital of the World.'
Spirit AeroSystems, Textron Aviation, and other aerospace companies employ thousands of skilled workers in Wichita.
Wichita has over 100 years of aviation innovation history, from early biplanes to modern jets.
Wichita's advanced manufacturing capabilities extend from general aviation to commercial aircraft components.
The skilled aerospace workforce in Wichita represents decades of knowledge passed down through generations.
The Keeper of the Plains, a 44-foot steel sculpture, has watched over Wichita since 1974.
Wichita's innovation ecosystem continues to evolve, with partnerships between universities and industry driving aerospace advancements.
From training WWII pilots to building the planes that connect our world, Wichita's aerospace legacy is unmatched.
